title: Coprimality and Euclid's lemma (cont.)
content: This section is about coprimality with respect to primes, and a special version of Euclid's lemma for primes is provided, see ~ euclemma .

blocks.name: coprm
blocks.content: A prime number either divides an integer or is coprime to it, but not both. Theorem 1.8 in [ApostolNT] p. 17. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 22-Jun-2011.)
blocks.origin:

thm coprm(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ)→(¬ c0[||]c1 ↔(c0[gcd]c1)= 1))
} = {
  impbid((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), ¬ c0[||]c1, (c0[gcd]c1)= 1)
  syld((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), ¬ c0[||]c1, (c0[gcd]c1)= 1, ¬(c0[gcd]c1)= c0)
  con3d((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), c0[||]c1, (c0[gcd]c1)= c0)
  syl5ibcom((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), (c0[gcd]c1)= c0, c0[||]c1, (c0[gcd]c1)[||]c1)
  simprd((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), (c0[gcd]c1)[||]c1, (c0[gcd]c1)[||]c0)
  breq1((c0[gcd]c1), c0, cdvds, c1)
  syl5ibrcom((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), ¬(c0[gcd]c1)= c0, (c0[gcd]c1)= 1, ((c0[gcd]c1)= 1 ∨(c0[gcd]c1)= c0))
  mp2d((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), ((c0[gcd]c1)= 1 ∨(c0[gcd]c1)= c0), (c0[gcd]c1)∈ ℕ, (c0[gcd]c1)[||]c0)
  simpld((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), (c0[gcd]c1)[||]c0, (c0[gcd]c1)[||]c1)
  sylan(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ, ((c0[gcd]c1)[||]c0 ∧(c0[gcd]c1)[||]c1), c0 ∈ ℤ)
  gcddvds(c0, c1)
  adantr(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ, ((c0[gcd]c1)∈ ℕ →((c0[gcd]c1)[||]c0 →((c0[gcd]c1)= 1 ∨(c0[gcd]c1)= c0))))
  syl5com(c0 ∈ Prime, (c0[gcd]c1)∈ ℕ, ((c0[gcd]c1)[||]c0 →((c0[gcd]c1)= 1 ∨(c0[gcd]c1)= c0)), ∀(hs0 ∈ ℕ,(hs0[||]c0 →(hs0 = 1 ∨ hs0 = c0))))
  simprbi(c0 ∈ Prime, ∀(hs0 ∈ ℕ,(hs0[||]c0 →(hs0 = 1 ∨ hs0 = c0))), c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 2))
  isprm2(hs0, c0)
  rspcv(hs0, (c0[gcd]c1), cn, (hs0[||]c0 →(hs0 = 1 ∨ hs0 = c0)), ((c0[gcd]c1)[||]c0 →((c0[gcd]c1)= 1 ∨(c0[gcd]c1)= c0)))
  imbi12d(hs0 =(c0[gcd]c1), hs0[||]c0, (hs0 = 1 ∨ hs0 = c0), (c0[gcd]c1)[||]c0, ((c0[gcd]c1)= 1 ∨(c0[gcd]c1)= c0))
  breq1(hs0, (c0[gcd]c1), cdvds, c0)
  orbi12d(hs0 =(c0[gcd]c1), hs0 = 1, hs0 = c0, (c0[gcd]c1)= 1, (c0[gcd]c1)= c0)
  eqeq1(hs0, (c0[gcd]c1), nat1)
  eqeq1(hs0, (c0[gcd]c1), c0)
  syl6bb(¬(c0[gcd]c1)= c0, (c0[gcd]c1)= 1, ((c0[gcd]c1)= 1 ∨(c0[gcd]c1)= c0), ((c0[gcd]c1)= c0 ∨(c0[gcd]c1)= 1))
  biorf((c0[gcd]c1)= c0, (c0[gcd]c1)= 1)
  orcom((c0[gcd]c1)= c0, (c0[gcd]c1)= 1)
  necon2bd((c0[gcd]c1), nat1, (c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), c0[||]c1)
  3syld((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), c0[||]c1, (c0[gcd]c1)≠ 1, c0[≤](c0[gcd]c1), 1[<](c0[gcd]c1))
  mpand((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), c0[||]c1, c0[≤](c0[gcd]c1), c0[||]c0)
  adantr(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ, c0[||]c0)
  syl(c0 ∈ Prime, c0[||]c0, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  iddvds(c0)
  mpd((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), ((c0[||]c0 ∧ c0[||]c1)→ c0[≤](c0[gcd]c1)), ¬(c0 = 0 ∧ c1 = 0))
  sylan(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ, (¬(c0 = 0 ∧ c1 = 0)→((c0[||]c0 ∧ c0[||]c1)→ c0[≤](c0[gcd]c1))), c0 ∈ ℤ)
  3anidm12(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℤ, (¬(c0 = 0 ∧ c1 = 0)→((c0[||]c0 ∧ c0[||]c1)→ c0[≤](c0[gcd]c1))))
  ex((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), ¬(c0 = 0 ∧ c1 = 0), ((c0[||]c0 ∧ c0[||]c1)→ c0[≤](c0[gcd]c1)))
  dvdslegcd(c0, c0, c1)
  mpand((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), c0[≤](c0[gcd]c1), 1[<](c0[gcd]c1), 1[<]c0)
  adantr(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ, 1[<]c0)
  prmgt1(c0)
  mp3an2ani(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ, ((1[<]c0 ∧ c0[≤](c0[gcd]c1))→ 1[<](c0[gcd]c1)), 1 ∈ ℝ, c0 ∈ ℝ, (c0[gcd]c1)∈ ℝ)
  zred(c0, c0 ∈ Prime)
  nnred((c0[gcd]c1), (c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ))
  mpd((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), (c0[gcd]c1)∈ ℕ, ¬(c0 = 0 ∧ c1 = 0))
  adantr(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ, ¬(c0 = 0 ∧ c1 = 0))
  intnanrd(c0 ∈ Prime, c0 = 0, c1 = 0)
  mtoi(c0 ∈ Prime, c0 = 0, 0 ∈ ℕ)
  0nnn()
  syl5ibcom(c0 ∈ Prime, c0 = 0, 0 ∈ ℕ, c0 ∈ ℕ)
  prmnn(c0)
  eleq1(c0, nat0, cn)
  sylan(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ, (¬(c0 = 0 ∧ c1 = 0)→(c0[gcd]c1)∈ ℕ), c0 ∈ ℤ)
  prmz(c0)
  ex((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), ¬(c0 = 0 ∧ c1 = 0), (c0[gcd]c1)∈ ℕ)
  gcdn0cl(c0, c1)
  ltletr(nat1, c0, (c0[gcd]c1))
  a1i((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), (1[<](c0[gcd]c1)→(c0[gcd]c1)≠ 1))
  mpan(1[<](c0[gcd]c1), (c0[gcd]c1)≠ 1, 1 ∈ ℝ)
  1re()
  ltne(nat1, (c0[gcd]c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c((c0[gcd]c1))
  diff.hs0.c(cn)
  diff.hs0.w(((c0[gcd]c1)[||]c0 →((c0[gcd]c1)= 1 ∨(c0[gcd]c1)= c0)))
}

blocks.name: prmrp
blocks.content: Unequal prime numbers are relatively prime. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Feb-2014.)

blocks.name: euclemma
blocks.content: Euclid's lemma. A prime number divides the product of two integers iff it divides at least one of them. Theorem 1.9 in [ApostolNT] p. 17. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 17-Nov-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm euclemma(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wb(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmul, c2)), wo(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1), wbr(c0, cdvds, c2))))
} = {
  impbid(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmul, c2)), wo(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1), wbr(c0, cdvds, c2)))
  syl6ibr(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmul, c2)), wo(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1), wbr(c0, cdvds, c2)), wi(wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wbr(c0, cdvds, c2)))
  expd(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmul, c2)), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wbr(c0, cdvds, c2))
  sylbid(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmul, c2)), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wbr(c0, cdvds, c2), wa(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmul, c2)), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  anbi2d(w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmul, c2)), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wb(wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  coprm(c0, c1)
  syl3an1(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wi(wa(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmul, c2)), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)), wbr(c0, cdvds, c2)), wcel(c0, cz))
  coprmdvds(c0, c1, c2)
  df-or(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1), wbr(c0, cdvds, c2))
  syl3an1(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wi(wo(wbr(c0, cdvds, c1), wbr(c0, cdvds, c2)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cmul, c2))), wcel(c0, cz))
  prmz(c0)
  ordvdsmul(c0, c1, c2)
}

blocks.name: isprm6
blocks.content: A number is prime iff it satisfies Euclid's lemma ~ euclemma . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm isprm6(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cprime), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wral(s0, cz, wral(s1, cz, wi(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(cv(s0), cmul, cv(s1))), wo(wbr(c0, cdvds, cv(s0)), wbr(c0, cdvds, cv(s1))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  impbii(wcel(c0, cprime), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wral(s0, cz, wral(s1, cz, wi(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(cv(s0), cmul, cv(s1))), wo(wbr(c0, cdvds, cv(s0)), wbr(c0, cdvds, cv(s1))))))))
  jca(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wral(s0, cz, wral(s1, cz, wi(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(cv(s0), cmul, cv(s1))), wo(wbr(c0, cdvds, cv(s0)), wbr(c0, cdvds, cv(s1)))))))
  prmuz2(c0)

blocks.name: prmdvdsexp
blocks.content: A prime divides a positive power of an integer iff it divides the integer. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Feb-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 17-Jul-2014.)
blocks.origin:

} = {
  3impa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cn), wb(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cexp, c2)), wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)))

  nnind(hs0, hs1, c2, wi(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cexp, c2)), wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wi(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cexp, cv(hs0))), wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wi(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cexp, nat1)), wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wi(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cexp, cv(hs1))), wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))), wi(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cexp, co(cv(hs1), caddc, nat1))), wbr(c0, cdvds, c1))))
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), nat1), wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cexp, cv(hs0))), wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)), wb(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cexp, nat1)), wbr(c0, cdvds, c1)))
  bibi1d(wceq(cv(hs0), nat1), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cexp, cv(hs0))), wbr(c0, cdvds, c1), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c1, cexp, nat1)))

blocks.name: prmndvdsfaclt
blocks.content: A prime number does not divide the factorial of a nonnegative integer less than the prime number. (Contributed by AV, 13-Jul-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm prmndvdsfaclt(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn0)), wi(wbr(c1, clt, c0), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, cfv(cfa, c1)))))
} = {
  sylbid(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn0)), wbr(c1, clt, c0), wn(wbr(c0, cdvds, cfv(cfa, c1))), wn(wbr(c0, cle, c1)))
  syl2anr(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn0), wb(wbr(c1, clt, c0), wn(wbr(c0, cle, c1))), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c0, cr))
  nn0re(c1)
  nnred(c0, wcel(c0, cprime))
  prmnn(c0)
  ltnle(c1, c0)
  con3d(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn0)), wbr(c0, cle, c1), wbr(c0, cdvds, cfv(cfa, c1)))
  impcom(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn0), wi(wbr(c0, cdvds, cfv(cfa, c1)), wbr(c0, cle, c1)))
  3exp(wcel(c1, cn0), wcel(c0, cprime), wbr(c0, cdvds, cfv(cfa, c1)), wbr(c0, cle, c1))
  prmfac1(c1, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm prmndvdsfaclt(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0)→(c1[<]c0 → ¬ c0[||](! ` c1)))
} = {
  sylbid((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0), c1[<]c0, ¬ c0[||](! ` c1), ¬ c0[≤]c1)
  syl2anr(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℕ0, (c1[<]c0 ↔ ¬ c0[≤]c1), c1 ∈ ℝ, c0 ∈ ℝ)
  nn0re(c1)
  nnred(c0, c0 ∈ Prime)
  prmnn(c0)
  ltnle(c1, c0)
  con3d((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0), c0[≤]c1, c0[||](! ` c1))
  impcom(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℕ0, (c0[||](! ` c1)→ c0[≤]c1))
  3exp(c1 ∈ ℕ0, c0 ∈ Prime, c0[||](! ` c1), c0[≤]c1)
  prmfac1(c1, c0)
}

  diff.hs1.w(wa(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wbr(c0, clt, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, nat2))), wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cdvds, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), cdvds, c1))))

blocks.name: cncongrprm
blocks.content: Corollary 2 of Cancellability of Congruences: Two products with a common factor are congruent modulo a prime number not dividing the common factor iff the other factors are congruent modulo the prime number. (Contributed by AV, 13-Jul-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm cncongrprm(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wcel(c3, cprime), wn(wbr(c3, cdvds, c2)))), wb(wceq(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), cmo, c3), co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmo, c3)), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c3), co(c1, cmo, c3))))
} = {
  syldan(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wcel(c3, cprime), wn(wbr(c3, cdvds, c2))), wb(wceq(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), cmo, c3), co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmo, c3)), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c3), co(c1, cmo, c3))), wa(wcel(c3, cn), wceq(co(c2, cgcd, c3), nat1)))
  jca(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wcel(c3, cprime), wn(wbr(c3, cdvds, c2)))), wcel(c3, cn), wceq(co(c2, cgcd, c3), nat1))
  ad2antrl(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wcel(c3, cprime), wn(wbr(c3, cdvds, c2)), wcel(c3, cn))
  prmnn(c3)
  imp(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wcel(c3, cprime), wn(wbr(c3, cdvds, c2))), wceq(co(c2, cgcd, c3), nat1))
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wi(wa(wcel(c3, cprime), wn(wbr(c3, cdvds, c2))), wceq(co(c2, cgcd, c3), nat1)))
  expimpd(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cprime), wn(wbr(c3, cdvds, c2)), wceq(co(c2, cgcd, c3), nat1))
  biimpd(wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cprime)), wn(wbr(c3, cdvds, c2)), wceq(co(c2, cgcd, c3), nat1))
  ancoms(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cprime), wb(wn(wbr(c3, cdvds, c2)), wceq(co(c2, cgcd, c3), nat1)))
  bitrd(wa(wcel(c3, cprime), wcel(c2, cz)), wn(wbr(c3, cdvds, c2)), wceq(co(c2, cgcd, c3), nat1), wceq(co(c3, cgcd, c2), nat1))
  coprm(c3, c2)
  eqeq1d(co(c3, cgcd, c2), nat1, co(c2, cgcd, c3), wa(wcel(c3, cprime), wcel(c2, cz)))
  sylan(wcel(c3, cprime), wcel(c2, cz), wceq(co(c3, cgcd, c2), co(c2, cgcd, c3)), wcel(c3, cz))
  prmz(c3)
  gcdcom(c3, c2)
  cncongrcoprm(c0, c1, c2, c3)
}

thm cncongrprm(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ (((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ c2 ∈ ℤ)∧(c3 ∈ Prime ∧ ¬ c3[||]c2))→(((c0[×]c2)[mod]c3)=((c1[×]c2)[mod]c3)↔(c0[mod]c3)=(c1[mod]c3)))
} = {
  syldan((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ c2 ∈ ℤ), (c3 ∈ Prime ∧ ¬ c3[||]c2), (((c0[×]c2)[mod]c3)=((c1[×]c2)[mod]c3)↔(c0[mod]c3)=(c1[mod]c3)), (c3 ∈ ℕ ∧(c2[gcd]c3)= 1))
  jca(((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ c2 ∈ ℤ)∧(c3 ∈ Prime ∧ ¬ c3[||]c2)), c3 ∈ ℕ, (c2[gcd]c3)= 1)
  ad2antrl((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ c2 ∈ ℤ), c3 ∈ Prime, ¬ c3[||]c2, c3 ∈ ℕ)
  prmnn(c3)
  imp((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ c2 ∈ ℤ), (c3 ∈ Prime ∧ ¬ c3[||]c2), (c2[gcd]c3)= 1)
  3ad2ant3(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℤ, c2 ∈ ℤ, ((c3 ∈ Prime ∧ ¬ c3[||]c2)→(c2[gcd]c3)= 1))
  expimpd(c2 ∈ ℤ, c3 ∈ Prime, ¬ c3[||]c2, (c2[gcd]c3)= 1)
  biimpd((c2 ∈ ℤ ∧ c3 ∈ Prime), ¬ c3[||]c2, (c2[gcd]c3)= 1)
  ancoms(c2 ∈ ℤ, c3 ∈ Prime, (¬ c3[||]c2 ↔(c2[gcd]c3)= 1))
  bitrd((c3 ∈ Prime ∧ c2 ∈ ℤ), ¬ c3[||]c2, (c2[gcd]c3)= 1, (c3[gcd]c2)= 1)
  coprm(c3, c2)
  eqeq1d((c3[gcd]c2), nat1, (c2[gcd]c3), (c3 ∈ Prime ∧ c2 ∈ ℤ))
  sylan(c3 ∈ Prime, c2 ∈ ℤ, (c3[gcd]c2)=(c2[gcd]c3), c3 ∈ ℤ)
  prmz(c3)
  gcdcom(c3, c2)
  cncongrcoprm(c0, c1, c2, c3)

blocks.name: isevengcd2
blocks.content: The predicate "is an even number". An even number and 2 have 2 as greatest common divisor. (Contributed by AV, 1-Jul-2020.) (Revised by AV, 8-Aug-2021.)

blocks.name: isoddgcd1
blocks.content: The predicate "is an odd number". An odd number and 2 have 1 as greatest common divisor. (Contributed by AV, 1-Jul-2020.) (Revised by AV, 8-Aug-2021.)

blocks.name: 3lcm2e6
blocks.content: The least common multiple of three and two is six. The operands are unequal primes and thus coprime, so the result is (the absolute value of) their product. (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 20-Jan-2020.) (Proof shortened by AV, 27-Aug-2020.)
